sentence: 'Tonight on Triple M Football there were unacceptable and inappropriate comments made by a member of the commentary team,' the station's head of content Mike Fitzpatrick said in a statement.
author: D. Lawrance For Daily Mail Australia
title: Controversial AFL star Barry Hall breaks down in tears as he admits he's 'got an anger issue' after 'almost killing' another player with a vicious punch in the face

sentence: AFL players who retired with concussion-related issues 2004 – 2009 Daniel Bell (2004 – 2009) Peter Burgoyne (1996 – 2009) Ronnie Burns (1993 – 2004) Daniel Chick (1994 – 2009) Tim Houlihan (2008 – 2009) Chad Liddell (1995 – 2008) Matthew Robbins (1996 – 2007) 2010 – 2015 Leigh Adams (2007 – 2014) Sam Blease (2011 – 2015) Justin Clarke (2013 – 2015) Andrew Krakouer (2001 – 2014) Matt Maguire (2002 – 2015) Graham Polak (2002 – 2010) Shane Tuck (2004 – 2013) Justin Koschitzke (2001 – 2013) 2016 – 2021 Patrick Bines (2019) Sean Dempster (2015 – 2017) Brad Ebert (2007 – 2020) Jack Fitzpatrick (2009 – 2017) Jack Frost (2013 – 2018) Levi Greenwood (2009 – 2021) Ben Jacobs (2011 – 2020) Kade Kolodjashnij (2014 – 2019) Billy Longer (2012 – 2019) Sam Michael (2013 – 2020) Lewis Pierce (2013 – 2018) Liam Picken (2009 – 2017) Sam Shaw (2012 – 2016) Bradley Sheppard (2009 – 2021) Ben Sinclair (2011 – 2016) Koby Stevens (2010 – 2018) Daniel Venables (2017 – 2019) Source: Peter Jess “Warnings from historic experiences within the AFL, such as the neurological impairments to players who had to retire from the accumulated impact of clinical and sub-clinical concussions such as Daniel Venables, Justin Koschitzke, Matt Maguire, Sam Blease, Sam Rowe, Koby Stevens, Kade Kolodjashnij, Jack Frost and many others that the AFL-AFLPA have a record from accessing career ending payments,” Jess wrote.
author: Jon Pierik
title: Complaint says 30 players retired due to concussion, Worksafe urged to prosecute AFL

sentence: The AFL hierarchy, in the form of then chairman Mike Fitzpatrick, were angered when Franklin went to the Swans at the end of 2013 on that monstrous deal, the league believing then that the Swans had used their contentious cost of living allowance (COLA) to purloin the superstar from Hawthorn; in reality, the AFL had hoped he’d cross to their new offspring, the Giants.
author: Jake Niall
title: Right place, right timing: AFL and game blessed Buddy landed in Sydney
Gillon McLachlan to leave AFL CEO role after 8 years
